Description: Hostname of the Clouddriver or gRPC proxy endpoint.
How often is the grpc ping sent.
Timeout before closing the grpc connection.

Client certificate file for mTLS.

0.3.0+ Optional bearer token added to each request back to the endpoint.

0.3.0+ Allows to invoke a command every refreshIntervalSeconds seconds that outputs either the token (format is raw) or a JSON object with an attribute of token if format is json or left empty. args is the optional list of parameters to the command.
0.3.1+ Ignore the HTTP_PROXY, HTTPS_PROXY, and NO_PROXY environment variables when connecting back to the control plane (Armory Enterprise).
0.3.1+ Ignore the HTTP_PROXY, HTTPS_PROXY, and NO_PROXY environment variables when connecting to any Kubernetes cluster.
How long to wait before reconnecting to Armory Enterprise.
Name of the Kubernetes cluster in Armory Enterprise.
Path to the kubeconfig file if not using serviceAccount.

Do not verify the TLS certificate of the Kubernetes API server
Don’t use without a good reason.
If provided, use the given context of the configured kubeconfig.

List of OAuth scope when authenticating with gcp provider
Cluster access for kubectl.
If true and the Agent runs in Kubernetes - use the current service account to call to the current API server. In that mode, you don’t need to provide a kubeconfig file.

0.4.0+ Whitelist of namespaces to monitor.
This comes at a greater cost of multiplying the resources by the number of namespaces.

Blacklist of namespaces
This comes at a greater cost of multiplying the resources by the number of namespaces.
NOT CURRENTLY IMPLEMENTED
0.4.0+ If true, the Agent ignores non-namespaced resources; namespaces must be whitelisted with namespaces setting and CRDs with customResourceDefinitons.
If not empty, only kinds in the list are cached. Use only the kind name in singular form and without group name (e.g. deployment, not deployment.apps). This also applies to CRDs.
List of kinds not to cache.
0.4.0+ List of CustomResourceDefinition to expose to Armory Enterprise. This is not needed if onlyNamespacedResources is left off. The format of kind is Kind.group.
When true, sends pod metrics back to Armory Enterprise every 20s.
List of permissions (currently READ or WRITE) with a list of authorized roles. For more information, see Permissions format.

When connecting to Armory Enterprise, the Agent asks Clouddriver for the latest resource version known per resource that is not older than that setting.

The resource version is used to resume the watch without first doing a list - saving memory and time. There’s no guarantee that the resource version is still known. If not “remembered” by the Kubernetes API server, a list call is used. Kubernetes API Concepts

Only return Armory Enterprise managed resources
NOT IMPLEMENTED in the Agent but added to the plugin see kubesvc.runtime.defaults.onlySpinnakerManaged.
0.3.1+ Ignore the HTTP_PROXY, HTTPS_PROXY, and NO_PROXY environment variables when connecting to that Kubernetes cluster.
Optional. Enable or disable retries when the Agent makes a failed request to the Kubernetes API server.
Optional. The number of times that the Agent will try the same request if it fails.
Optional. How much time (in milliseconds) to wait between retry attempts.
Optional. If true, Agent will retry when encountering any error from the Kubernetes API server. If false, Agent will only retry if the error contains any item from retryableErrors.
Optional. If the error from the Kubernetes API server contains any item from this list, the request will be retried. Requires retryAnyError to be false.
File to save logs to.
Format for the Agent logs. Can be text or json

Log level. Can be any of (case insensitive):
panic, fatal , error, warn (or warning), info, debug, trace.

Enable pprof endpoint. Useful for troubleshooting, slowness, memory leaks, and more!
pprof README.
Port on which to respond to pprof requests.
Enable Prometheus handler.
Port to expose Prometheus metrics on. Responds to both /metrics (standard) and /prometheus_metrics (Armory Enterprise default).
Hostname of the server health check.
Port of the server health check.
Various options to control TLS config. Don’t bother, it’s just for the health endpoint.
Vault configuration.
If > 0, limits the number of tasks that can be started. Tasks have different cost. Watches are considered free because they are part of the normal operations of the Agent.
Same as totalBudget but per account. If both settings are provided, they’re both checked.
Frequency at which the Agent checks for new tasks to launch. Once launched a task is not stopped until explicitly requested (account unregistered or connection to Armory Enterprise lost).
0.5.12+ The maximum length of time to wait before giving up on a server request. A value of zero means no timeout.
